Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: xtwigx
Reviews.Content: Thank god I was only staying here 1 night. If felt like a high security jail with all the barred gates & windows. If I had not stayed in this area previously I would have been very worried!! Girl on reception friendy & helpful. No lift so had to drag all my luggage myself & negoiate the security gates aswell. Room basic & sparse. After settling in I realised the bed was wet, the previous occupant had wet the bed & the cleaner has just put clean bedding on top!!! My room was changed straight away, & the receptionist was very appologetic, but the place did not feel clean or comfortable. The overall impression was shabby & dirty. Outside I noticed there was a For Sale sign, so maybe the new owners will improve the place.

Reviews.Title: “Miss the feeling of traveling in a third world country?”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: Well you've come to the right place! Highfield Hotel offers you the experience of traveling in a third world country (without the ordeal of going through customs) at familiar first world prices. While the bars on the windows, multiple key point access, and digital room locks can be overwhelming at first, they remind you how dangerous the area you are staying in is in a way that parallels the fear I had of being kidnapped while traveling through south america. Even though the lack of hygiene and sanitation adds to the charm, I remind everyone to boil the water before they drink it (as I'm sure it will move your intestines in ways it shouldn't) because Highfield goes that extra mile to make their water extra murky. My only recommendation is that they trade in the van they use as an airport shuttle for a tuk-tuk to complete the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highfield hotel more like lowfield”
Reviews.Author: Danielle K
Reviews.Content: do not stay here, we booked this as an alternative to hostels as we had previously been staying in hostels and wanted to stay in a hotel..... this is 10000 times worse than any hostel i have ever stayed in. the only good thing about this place is the security it makes you feel like your staying in a jail the rooms are disgusting and smelly, the fridge was covered in what look like poo all over it there were bugs flying everywhere the sheets were dirty i had sleep with a towel on me the rooms are hot and smelly i defiantly do not recommend staying here you'd be better of staying at a hostel and for the price of this place and what you get for your money is an absolute joke! you also have to share dirty dirty toilets and showers bottom line DO NOT STAY HERE!! I WOULD HAVE RATHER OF BEEN CAMPING...

Reviews.Title: “Be careful what you wish for...”
Reviews.Author: Ivor P
Reviews.Content: If you wanted a backpacker hotel, well this is one, I suppose. Let's start with the positives. 1. Clean linen 2. Secure - a good thing in a dodgy area with some strange life forms after dark 3. Close to city by bus 4. friendly staff that's about it. Condition of the building is abysmal: whoever owns it (and must be making a lot of money out of it) should be forced to live there for a month. Communal toilets and showers are functioning, but you wouldn't want to spend long in them. They are however, well cleaned each morning: just be careful later in the day. Like other reviewers, I think you can do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “There will find better accommodation elsewhere with what you pay for Highfield.”
Reviews.Author: Paul_PaulSG
Reviews.Content: The accommodation is old and just has the basic amenities. Dirty stairways are infested with dead bugs. Heater is almost non existent during winter. The only positives are the excellent location and basic breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Does Australia Have a Board of Health?”
Reviews.Author: carlYYC
Reviews.Content: Only 2 positives: The staff was very nice, very polite and the linens were clean. That's it! This is nothing but an overpriced backpacker hostel (and there are cleaner backpacker hostels on the same block at half the price!) To call this a "hotel" is total deception! If there is an Australian Board of Health, they are either totally incompetent or being paid-off...this place should be shut down before someone gets sick. Mold everywhere and especially the shared baths/toilets!!! Disgusting! Other negatives are exactly as the other feedbacks state: Noisy, dirty, in total need of renovation, totally unsuitable for handicapped access, etc, etc, etc. Amazing, this dump doesn't have a single positive comment. If you can't find another available hotel in Sydney (at any price), then stay home or sleep in your car!

Reviews.Title: “WORST EVER! LITERALLY DO.NOT.WASTE.YOUR.TIME.”
Reviews.Author: globertrotter23
Reviews.Content: This hostel should not even be available to stay at, or view as a place to stay. They took my money after I cancelled the booking well before the 72hour refund policy, I was expecting a standard cancellation fee of $25AUD, but I was wrongly charged the full amount. With an explanation from them that didnt make any sense. They were in the wrong. Rude Staff. Dodgy Policies, and I strongly feel they borderline scam artist. DO NOT give them your details. I hope you get this review and those from others before booking in to the hell.

Reviews.Title: “Remove this place from booking.com etc”
Reviews.Author: Dudlymoore
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why you can still find this so called hotel on many bookingsites. I wrote a mail to booking.com and they told me to look at it. That was 3 months ago...and still no change.. All they have to do is remove it from the site and the place will close his doors in one month because no one would stay there more than one night! I think this place is runned by the Indian mob. One night I saw some heavy indian guys standing behind the receptiondesk and walking away with I think pretty sure a bag of money.. So that's even a beter reason to close this dump! Come on, bookingsites..listen to your customers!!!

Reviews.Title: “2* Hotel????”
Reviews.Author: lexy_healer
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights at the Potts Point Hotel Feb/ Mar 11. first the positives - reception staff were alright and one got internet wifi vouchers for each day staying (twice the voucher I was given did not work - and reception staff were a somewhat perplexed with the problem, supposedly re-booted the whole system, when they just needed to give me a new voucher (perhaps they were suspiciouse I missused the download limit?, but the second time I came back after like 5 min and who can download 500MB in 5 min? - not my laptop) negatives - room was booked as a double, but used just by one person. room was tiny, i.e. bed, fridge, sink, TV (not sure is functional - DVD player was broken out, even though DVDs were on rental offer at reception) and two small nite stands - NO wardrobe space whatsoever, no hangers, no room to put the suitcase except under the bed. pained in funky yellow color scheme, but like the rest of the Hotel (especially toilet and shower rooms in dire need of a re-paint. previouse tenants had decorated my room walls with squshed insects (no wonder - no screens at windows and windows so old that alot of gaps (even if closed)) - but room-cleaning did not seem to see it frinedly to wipe off the bloody smears from walls. Shower and toilet room superficially clean, but ingrained stains in shower floor (i.e. last re-furbed, form the looks - 15+ years ago). Paint on ceiling flacky and moldy. Breakfast??? - there was some bread lying out in the kitchen, but milk, butter and jam were to be found in the fridge - not labelled in anyway though (and big butter chunk still in it's wrapper), not sure if I ate the Hotels or some other occupants - everybodies food was all over the fridge. Skipped the breakfast after one try. I am aware that Potts Point did not advertise luxery - and am aware that a 2* is not a 3 or 4*. I was aware that bathrooms would be shared, in my mind that was what made the 2* rating. I chose Potts Point over the backpacker hostels on offer, though slightly more expensive, as it was called HOTEL and I thought therefore I could expect slightly more comfort than in a Hostel. There was a backpacker hostel right next door - it looked much better than Potts Point from the outside -would have moved there, if I had not pre-payed my stay at Potts through the internet.

Reviews.Title: “backpackerhostel where you need to be grateful”
Reviews.Author: Aussieparadise
Reviews.Content: booked single got a 3bed 'cabinet' with no further room to move for AUD 100 per night.had a Fridge and TVin room as well as a sink and a fan. 'window' to 50 cm away-neighbourhouse wall. When arrived at 4 pm room not ready but on check out day 15minutes extension to 10:15 am where something that alomost needed fighting and than was given with a lot of mercy. Hairdryer could be requested, but when wishing for anything at the reception it could happen that you wait 5-10 min until a (private?) phone call was finished.

Reviews.Title: “Downtrodden, Rundown Halfway House Hostal!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeymate
Reviews.Content: This Backpackers hostal/halfway house is the pits and should be struck off any website, better off knocked down! No Nightporter at night times, had to make my own bed, bars on windows, communal shared bathrooms and toilets, I asked for a takeaway sandwich for breakfast (flight 6am to Melbourne) and the lady said "no". No staff interest whatsover - lacking social skills and customer service. The only good thing is the location, but it is in a dodgy red light district to be fair as I saw some police action which involved drunks...believe me, it would ruin your holiday if you stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “What A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: johna1979
Reviews.Content: The staff are absolutely rude and the rooms very discusting one room we opened the door and it hit into one of the beds we were told if we made any noise we would be thrown out so i demanded my money back...NEVER STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Don't go near this place with ten foot barge pole”
Reviews.Author: californiagirlsydney
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 6 nights as I wanted to stay somewhere that didn't have a dorm but wouldn't cost too much. I left after one night. The bed and room had hairs all over it. The fridge was rusty inside and outside and froze anything you put in it. The tv was very old and sat on top of the fridge. It only got 3 tv stations. The room around the bed was only 2 feet across and I had a single bed bunk on top of the double. The dining room kitchen could only accomodate 4 people at a time. I booked through a third party they refunded my money. When I left the hotel and returned my key the lady at the desk yelled at me and refused to give me my key money back.

Reviews.Title: “Be selective in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: PortugalExplorers
Reviews.Content: On our return from our world trip I am adding reviews to the places we stayed along the way. Book in advance!!! Is our advice, we arrived in Sydney with no reservation and the place was CHOCABLOCK! We could not find a decent room at a decent price for love nor money! Out of desperation we stayed at the Highfield Hotel. It was ropey, strange, lacklustre, old, dated and not 100% clean. But we grinned and beared it and used the free wifi, and got ourselves booked the following day at a hostel down the road. Not an awful experience, but certainly nothing to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: lola2010
Reviews.Content: On booking this "hotel" we didn't realise it was a hostel. The windows were paper thin, as were the walls, and there was constant building work going on next door. You could have kept the window open and it would be the same. There were two bathrooms in the whole hostel, a gents bathroom on the first floor and ladies on second. I cried for hours when we arrived, but as we were booked in for almost two weeks we could not afford to go elsewhere. A horrific start to our holidays. At night time there is no security there so it is worse than a zoo. Don't expect to get a nights sleep. Groups come at the week-ends and roar and shout all night long. One guy put his hand through the window above us after hours of drinking and fighting all night and there were people constantly screaming, ambulances called, etc. Then when we finally got to sleep on the Saturday morning, management were replacing the broken window and the steam set off the fire alarm, so we were all evacuated. Another night, I went to the bathroom in the middle of the night, and there was a guy asleep almost naked in the girls shower with the door open. It is dirty, with plaster coming off the walls, a horrible, horrible place. Should be knocked down, or at least investigated by health and safety and shut down. People should be allowed to stay for free.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay there!”
Reviews.Author: blackpearl_ag
Reviews.Content: All other negative reviews are totally true. In my opinion, the only plus was the free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Ho Hum, but its a bed”
Reviews.Author: irukandjisting
Reviews.Content: Paid about 65 Australian dollars for this hotel double room... shared showers and toilets which could have been cleaned more, shower tap on floor, and also includes a breakfast like a couple loaves of bread and jam and margarine in the fridge with the milk... help yourself....pretty basic... but very central as only being 200m from Kings Cross station... the room sheets were clean and there was a TV and wash basin in room.... passable, but then I have travelled lots, so my expectations are realistic with the price....just don't expect too much, I have stayed there 3 times over the last 3 years and nothing changes...

Reviews.Title: “Oh My God! DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: CrustyP
Reviews.Content: Small dank rooms, no toilet seat, dirty smelly bathroom, Wifi didn't work, breakfast is very very very very cheap and not continental its a few loaves of bread, the Chinese women at reception was aggresive and lacking very basic customer service skills, TV not working and staff not willing to replace it! DO YOURSELF A FAVOUR AND DON'T SATY HERE EVEN IF YOUR ON A BUDGET, STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: chchnz
Reviews.Content: very untidy, dirty just over all hideous! reception staff could hardly speak english. if you have booked here already sorry but you have made a mistake like i did!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!! Or if you've booked already, get out of there quickly!!”
Reviews.Author: snooze83
Reviews.Content: I booked this place on the internet (beautiful looking website) for 5 nights, but I stayed there exactly one day, not even for the night as I came home from my first trip through the city after I arrived and I switched the lights in my room on only to witness 5 bed bugs crawling under my blanket on my bed.. It is an absolutely disgusting place! Do not stay there! I ended up moving into the Holiday Inn down the road and asking for all my money back! The rooms are prison cells, it smells like damp mould in the entire hotel, the breakfast is nothing but a joke!!!!!!! Seriously! This is a horrible horrible place! The staff doesn't care about your trouble and if you go there you are very likely to bring bed bugs back into your home with you! avoid this place!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Run!”
Reviews.Author: Gordon_Bennett_NZ
Reviews.Content: Looks lovely on its website - sad that none of the claims are true. They even fake their own testimonials (or just happen to have had 5 people who thought exactly the same). We had to threaten legal action to get our money back. I've been around - 51 countries now - and have stayed in some dives in my time, but this one was the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: watzup
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Highfield in May 2007 and had a dreadful experience. I had also gone through its website and booked based on what I read. I was expecting a small but clean boutique hotel. For the 2 nights I stayed at Highfield, I had no sleep. There were no rules on noise after reasonable hours and guests are allowed to hang out in the common room until the wee hours of the morning. Some guests were obviously drinking and there was a lot of shouting. In desperation, I had to stick my head out of the window (which faces a wall) many times to plea to them to lower down their voices. The bathrooms are dirty and smelly and for breakfast in the common room, you will need to share dirty cutleries and plates and dig into a common tub of margarine. Dont stay at this hotel unless you get really really cheap rates and you can sleep through anything.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ever Ever Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: wearytravellerDurban
Reviews.Content: You have got to be kidding. Do NOT believe its own ad. "A complimentary continental breakfast is served daily in the dining room from 07.30-12.00." There is no dining room, 2 loaves of bread and a tin of jam for the whole "hotel", no cutlery, plates, milk. No service. "The hotel has 33, spacious and fully-furnished rooms with large windows either looking out on the tranquil and leafy surroundings or the city." Wrong looked onto an alley with dustbins, spacious, maybe for a midget. "Rooms include; wireless internet access; flat screen colour TV with remote control and DVD player; bath towels; heater and fan; wash hand basin; tea and coffee-making facilities; refrigerator; iron and hairdryer." Don't even let me start on this part. If this "hotel" existed in South Africa, anywhere in South Africa, it would be condemned, you need to swim in a sewer after using their ablutions to feel clean. Its a miracle we didn't catch something. Do yourself a favour, dig deeper and find somewhere a little more expensive that doesn't blatantly lie (not just distort the truth a little) in its adverts.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: eatandstay
Reviews.Content: This was the most unpleasant hostel experience I had in all of Australia (in 3 months of travel around the country). The rooms were absurdly small - I had to be on the bed in order for my husband to open the door enough to get out of the room, the bathrooms were filthy and the staff didn't seem to have a clue what was going on. I was really disappointed. Even for those traveling on a budget, there are much better options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!!”
Reviews.Author: DeeNz
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! While I was well aware I was booking into a cheap and not very spacious hotel, I too was robbed while staying at the Highfield, and the break in was not a forced entry, someone had used a key to break into the room. To say that the staff were completely unhelpful is a complete inderstatement....they would not even lend me a pen whilst i was trying to sort out urgent replacement of my car keys.... Unfortuantely, in hindsight, it was false economy staying at this place, so please, if you have to stay there leave nothing important in your room....

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here...”
Reviews.Author: canberrajimmy
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in an awesome location, close to train station, clubs etc.. The rooms are tiny, i was expexting small but they had no room at all to move, no heating, and a terrible smell. And to top it all off we had a theft from our locked room(by someone who has a key-no forced entry!) while we were out, Manager and staff no help at all when this occured and had to call the police- a really great end to a great day..........NOT. .

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a desperate dump!”
Reviews.Author: modaffyduck
Reviews.Content: My daughter and two friends have just had two nights at this hotel which I booked for her using Lonely Planet guide book. They claimed that is a particularly clean hotel as it is run by Swedes. My daughter described it to me as really disgustingly dirty and a a real dump. The bathroom is filthy, the room is filthy and she was quite nervous of leaving her belongings there when they went out. She had to stay the second night as Sydney was full for Easter. They hated the hotel and said it was a real dirty dump and they would not recommend it to anyone. Don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “OK Cheap Hotel - but don't stay during winter”
Reviews.Author: Ivt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for about one week. My prime consideration was price - the airfare has already made me run out of my trip budget. The hotel is situated in quite nice district of Sydney. I think it is especially nice place during summer when all the trees around are green. But anyway - many small eateries around, nice building and flights of parrots. You can catch subway to go to the center or walk (40-50 minutes walk to the Circular Quays) First, what I liked about the hotel. It is very clean, common shower and WC are just perfect. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The owners are swedes, that is why many nordic tourists are staying here. What I did not like. It was awfully cold. The room does not have heating and has ventilation holes straight to the outside (at +5-7C/41-45F night temperature in Jul). The only way to heat the rooms is to use some small heating fan. But it automatically stops after 5 minutes of working. So, the first night when I did not have suplementary blankets I was getting up each 30-40 minutes to heat the room. Afterwards they showed me a wardrobe with blankets, I took 3 and was more less fine. You can imagine that having shower at such temperature was not great pleasure too. Another problem, much more minor, was that there were small construction works in the garden under my windows, but I'm sure they are finished by now. So my conclusion: nice place to stay when it is not too cold or if you are used to it (as probably these nordic guys are). Small note: there is a nice food cart in 5 min walk: just descend to Woolloomooloo bay. They sell very nice mash pies.

HotelInfo.Name: Highfield Private Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 166 Victoria Street | Potts Point, Sydney, New South Wales 2011, Australia
